column6: North}}</ref> died aged 158) was the son of [[Araglas]] and seventh [[Chieftain of the Dúnedain]]

column1: He following his father, in Chieftainship, when Araglas died in 2455.
His rule coincided with the end of the [[Watchful Peace]], when [[Sauron]] returned to [[Dol Guldur]] with increased strength.<ref>{{App
column2: TA}}</ref> Also during his rule, [[orcs]] began to increase and multiply in the [[Misty Mountains]]; it was then when they revealed themselves, waylaiding [[Celebrían]] and her escort.<ref>{{App

column3: n}}, after having ruled for sixty-eight years, and was followed by his son, [[Aragost]].<ref name="North"/>

column1: Arahad's name is [[Sindarin]], but its etymology is uncertain. It contains the usual royal prefix ''[[ar
column2: ara-]]'' meaning "king", but the ''had'' is a little harder to work out. It could be ''had'' meaning "hurl, throw", it could be ''sad'' ([[Lenition
column3: lenited]] to ''had'') meaning "place, spot", or it could be related to ''sador'' meaning "faithful person".

column2:
house=[[House of Isildur]]
Cadet branch of [[House of Elros]]
